page.title: 09SCLATER'S NURSERIES,EXETER.
page.content: Sclaters Nurseries is situated in Okehampton Rd. A Priory was built on the site in the Middle Ages. The business was established in 1780 by James Sclater whose family still own and work it.It has been at its present site since 1920. When the priory was demolished the land returned to fields. It has been said that there is a ghost, but it has not been reported for many years. Several old clay smoking pipes and other pottery relics have been found. The owner of the nursery now is Mr.A.J.Sclater. Vegetables, bedding and potting plants are grown there with about 100,000 pot plants. Chemical fertilizers are used plus a secret family formula. Some plants are imported from Holland, Turkey and Ireland. Plants are sold directly to the public or at local markets.
